statement: Person A's hand is higher than person B's hand in terms of the ranking of poker hands.
context: Person A and Person B are playing a card game with a deck of poker cards. Image 0 shows the hand of Person A, and Image 1 displays the hand of Person B. Each player is allowed to draw only three cards, and there is only one deck of cards in play, which does not contain jokers.
reasoning: Image0 -> Person A's hand consists of JJA.

Conclusion1 + Text3 -> Person B's hand consists of a straight.
Conclusion2 + Text6 -> Person A's hand is lower than a straight.
Conclusion3 + Conclusion4 -> Person A's hand is lower than person B's hand in terms of poker ranking.
textual_clue: Leopard: Three cards of the same rank.
Straight flush: Three consecutive cards of the same suit.
Jinhua: Three cards of the same suit that are not consecutive.
Flush: Three consecutive cards of different suits.
Pair: Three cards with two cards of the same rank.
Single card: Any card not included in the above combinations.
Ranking order:Leopard > Straight flush > Jinhua > Flush > Pair > Single card.
